Message.Title: Yahoo strengthens foothold in China
Message.Msg: Yahoo!, which owns a 24% stake in Alibaba, will benefit from the Weibo deal. Through Alibaba, Yahoo! will own an indirect 4.3% stake in Sina. This could actually strengthen Yahoo’s foothold in China, where other western companies such as Google and Microsoft have clumsily fumbled. Last quarter, Yahoo!’s profit from its two major Asian investments, Alibaba and Yahoo! Japan, came in at $217.5 million - topping the company’s core business profit of $186 million.

Message.Title: Summary of Yahoo traffic
Message.Msg: April saw a decrease of 2% on global internet users who visit Yahoo, per Alexa's , now it stands at 19.82% (before was 20.21%) this seems to be the impact of the services shut-downs, if this is so, then we should expect another 1%-2% decrease in May to about low 19%. The good news is that the US percentage of total usage is still increasing, now standing in 34.3! (When I started following the metric it was 32%). Per Statcounter, US mobile search is still growing, this week it stands at 10.3%, at the beginning of the year it was 7.97%. This has been a slow, but constant chipping away to Google. If the rate continues it should have 20% of the market by years end.
